>>147551239
Rice, beans, lentils, canned meat, soup, sardines, tuna, etc. Also ramens a good cheap prep item and you can literally cook them with electricity by just soaking in water if things ever got real bad. Also rubbing alcohol and peroxide are good to keep on hand. In extreme cases a box and emergency blanket could make a solar oven. I strongly advise you to check into a life straw or waterbob just because theyre good to keep on hand anyway. They filter stuff even out of river water to make it safe for drinking without having to keep a huge tank supply on hand. Get out of the city if possible take a family camping trip or vacation. Stay with family if you can. Better to be safe than sorry if you have kids. Good luck

147585136.name: Anonymous
147585136.comment:
from wikipedia

Cohen-Watnick was brought into the United States National Security Council by Michael T. Flynn, the former Director of the Defense Intelligence Agency and President Donald Trump's first National Security Advisor. He was named the NSC's senior director for intelligence programs.

Following Flynn's resignation in February 2017, the new National Security Advisor, H. R. McMaster, attempted to remove Cohen-Watnick, but he was overruled by Trump. McMaster attempted to replace Cohen-Watnick with CIA official Linda Weissgold, the author of the infamous Benghazi talking points and a member of the "Benghazi dream team", a group of intelligence community analysts assembled to counter the Congressional investigation into the Benghazi Affair.

Cohen-Watnick allegedly inadvertently identified reports suggesting that members of Trump's campaign team had been subjected to incidental surveillance by the United States intelligence community, as part of an unrelated review of privacy procedures.
